title: MEANING CONNECTORS (SECONDARY SET)
paragraphs: ğŸŸ¦ STEP 1 â€” BASIC CARD (DEFINITION CARD)

MODULE 0.1.2 â€” MEANING CONNECTORS (SECONDARY SET)
 Prepositions â€¢ Determiners (this/that/these/those) â€¢ Conjunctions (coordinating, subordinating, correlative)
â­ BASIC CARD (0.1.2: Meaning Connectors)
ENGLISH (main explanation)
Meaning connectors are helper words that link ideas and make sentences clear.
This set covers 3 groups:
Prepositions â€” show location, time, or direction. Examples: **in** (blue), **on** (blue), **under** (blue), **before** (blue), **after** (blue), **beside** (blue)

Determiners (this/that/these/those) â€” point to specific things:
 **this** (green) = near + singular
 **that** (green) = far + singular
 **these** (green) = near + plural
 **those** (green) = far + plural

Conjunctions â€” connect words, phrases, or clauses:
 Coordinating: **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange), **so** (orange), **yet** (orange)
 Subordinating: **because** (orange), **although** (orange), **when** (orange), **while** (orange), **after** (orange)
 Correlative: **eitherâ€¦or** (orange), **neitherâ€¦nor** (orange), **bothâ€¦and** (orange)
Coordinating conjunctions join equal parts (words, phrases, or independent clauses).
Subordinating conjunctions link a main idea with a dependent idea (reason, time, contrast).
Correlative conjunctions work in pairs to balance two ideas.
Very simple.
â­ CEBUANO
Ang â€œmeaning connectorsâ€ kay mga pulong nga nagdugtong ug nagklaro sa ideya sa sentence.
Prepositions â€“ nagpakita sa lugar/oras/direksyon. Pananglitan: **sa** (blue), **sa ibabaw** (blue), **sa kilid** (blue).
Determiners â€“ nagtimaan kung duol o layo, usa o daghan: **this** (green), **that** (green), **these** (green), **those** (green).
Conjunctions â€“ nagdugtong sa mga pulong o clause: **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange), **because** (orange), **although** (orange).
Coordinating conjunctions â€“ nagdugtong ug parehas nga bahin (pulong, phrase, o independent clause) gamit **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange).
Subordinating conjunctions â€“ naglink sa main idea ug dependent idea (rason, oras, contrast) gamit **because** (orange), **although** (orange), **when** (orange).
Correlative conjunctions â€“ naglihok nga pares aron ipares ang duha ka ideya: **eitherâ€¦or** (orange), **neitherâ€¦nor** (orange), **bothâ€¦and** (orange).
â­ HILIGAYNON
Ang â€œmeaning connectorsâ€ amo ang mga pulong nga nagaugnay sang ideya para klaro ang pangungusap.
Prepositions â€“ nagatudlo sang lugar/tion/direksyon. Halimbawa: **sa** (blue), **sa tupad** (blue), **antes** (blue).
Determiners â€“ nagasignals kung lapit o malayo, isa o madamo: **this** (green), **that** (green), **these** (green), **those** (green).
Conjunctions â€“ nagakonektar sang tinaga o clause: **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange), **because** (orange), **although** (orange).
Coordinating conjunctions â€“ nagakonektar sang pareho nga parte (mga tinaga, phrase, o independent clause) gamit **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange).
Subordinating conjunctions â€“ nagaugnay sang main idea kag dependent idea (rason, tion, contrast) gamit **because** (orange), **although** (orange), **when** (orange).
Correlative conjunctions â€“ nagatrabaho sa pares para ibalanse ang duha ka ideya: **eitherâ€¦or** (orange), **neitherâ€¦nor** (orange), **bothâ€¦and** (orange).
â­ ILOKANO
Dagiti â€œmeaning connectorsâ€ ket sao a mangikonekta ken mangklaro kadagiti pagbanagan.
Prepositions â€“ mangipakita iti lugar/oras/direksyon. Kuna dagiti: **iti** (blue), **iti rabaw** (blue), **sakbay** (blue).
Determiners â€“ mangipakita nu asideg wenno adayo, maysa wenno adu: **this** (green), **that** (green), **these** (green), **those** (green).
Conjunctions â€“ mangidugtong kadagiti sao wenno clause: **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange), **because** (orange), **although** (orange).
Coordinating conjunctions â€“ mangidugtong iti agpada a parte (sao, phrase, wenno independent clause) gamit **and** (orange), **but** (orange), **or** (orange).
Subordinating conjunctions â€“ mangilink iti main idea ken dependent idea (rason, oras, contrast) gamit **because** (orange), **although** (orange), **when** (orange).
Correlative conjunctions â€“ agtrabaho iti pares a mangbalanse iti dua a ideya: **eitherâ€¦or** (orange), **neitherâ€¦nor** (orange), **bothâ€¦and** (orange).
â­ TAGALOG
Ang â€œmeaning connectorsâ€ ay mga salitang nag-uugnay at nagpapalinaw ng ideya sa pangungusap.
Prepositions â€“ lugar/oras/direksyon.
Determiners â€“ nagpapakita kung malapit o malayo, isa o marami (this/that/these/those).
Conjunctions â€“ nagdurugtong ng salita o sugnay (and/but/or; because/although/when; eitherâ€¦or).
Coordinating conjunctions â€“ nag-uugnay ng magkakapantay na bahagi (salita, parirala, o buong sugnay).
Subordinating conjunctions â€“ nagdudugtong ng main idea at dependent idea (dahilan, oras, contrast).
Correlative conjunctions â€“ magkapares na nagbabalansi ng dalawang ideya.
â­ KAPAMPANGAN
Ing â€œmeaning connectorsâ€ ila reng salita a manugtung at mangpaklaru king idea ning sentence.
Prepositions â€“ manyulat lugad/oras/direksyon.
Determiners â€“ manyulat makalapit o makalayu, metung o dakal (this/that/these/those).
Conjunctions â€“ manugtung salita o clause (and/but/or; because/although/when; eitherâ€¦or).
Coordinating conjunctions â€“ manugtung king kapantayan a parte (salita, phrase, o independent clause).
Subordinating conjunctions â€“ manugtung king main idea at king dependent idea (dahilan, oras, contrast).
Correlative conjunctions â€“ magpares a manyabye balanse king aduang ideya.
ğŸŸ© STEP 2 â€” TWO FILIPINO-LOCALIZED EXAMPLES
(Examples only â€” localized using Filipino names, places, and contexts.)
â­ EXAMPLE 1 â€” Preposition + movement

EN: The boat went **across** (blue) the river **after** (blue) sunrise.
 CEB: Ang bangka mitabok **sa** (blue) suba **pagkahuman** (blue) mosubang ang adlaw.
 HIL: Nagtabok ang bangka **sa** (blue) suba **pagkatapos** (blue) magsubang ang adlaw.
 ILO: Nakitabok ti bangka **iti** (blue) karayan **kalpasanna** (blue) nga immuliw ti init.
 TAG: Tumawid ang bangka **sa** (blue) ilog **matapos** (blue) sumikat ang araw.
 KAP: Mekitawid ing banka **king** (blue) ilug **kaybat** (blue) sumubang ing aldo.
â­ EXAMPLE 2 â€” Determiner + conjunctions

EN: **These** (green) notebooks are for Dani, **but** (orange) **those** (green) on the shelf are for you.
 CEB: **Kini** (green) nga notebooks para kang Dani, **pero** (orange) katong **naa** (green) sa estante para nimo.
 HIL: **Ining** (green) mga notebook para kay Dani, **pero** (orange) ang **yara** (green) sa estante para sa imo.
 ILO: **Dagitoy** (green) a notebook para kenni Dani, **ngem** (orange) dagidiay **adda** (green) iti estante ket para kenka.
 TAG: **Itong** (green) mga kuwaderno ay para kay Dani, **pero** (orange) **yung** (green) nasa estante ay para sa iyo.
 KAP: **Reni** (green) ngan notebooks para kang Dani, **pero** (orange) **deng** (green) atiu king estante para keka.
ğŸŸ§ STEP 3 â€” â€œREADY?â€ SCREEN
